Topic.Title: IBM Breaks Efficiency Mark with Novel Solar Material

Message.Msg: IBM taking two paths toward making solar power cheaper than fossil fuels Both technologies have a shot at hitting the crucial $2 per Watt price point. by John Timmer - Aug 22, 2012 2:51 pm UTC The price of photovoltaic hardware has dropped so dramatically in recent years that, according to some projections, a well-sited panel may become competitive with fossil fuels before the decade is out. To reach that point, which comes when panels cost below $2 per Watt, prices will have to continue their steep decline. During our visit to IBM's Watson research center, we talked to two people who are working on ways to drive the cost down—but they are taking radically different approaches. The prior referenced article is one of the paths (CZTS), the other is solar concentrators. Read more: http://arstechnica.com/science/2012/08/ibm-taking-two-paths-toward-making-solar-power-cheaper-than-fossil-fuels/?comments=1#comments-bar

Message.Title: IBM Watson making progress ...
Message.Msg: IBM Watson making progress to becoming a useful medical assistant for diagnosis and treatment planning IBM is working with several US hospitals to build a virtual physicians' assistant using Watson, the AI that won the TV show Jeopardy. To test the system, Watson was first tasked with answering questions taken from Doctor's Dilemma, a competition for trainee doctors that takes place at the annual meeting of the American College of Physicians. Watson was given 188 questions that it had not seen before and achieved around 50 per cent accuracy - not bad for an early test, but hardly ideal. An update, more here: http://nextbigfuture.com/2012/08/ibm-watson-making-progress-to-becoming.html

Topic.Title: High Un-employment, No Growth, Massive Deficits...

Message.Msg: At least Bush understood that capitalism is what built the wealth of our country. Obama HATES capitalism... that's why he has left the corporate tax rate the highest in the world and that's why he wants to tax the crap out of those with investment capital. No citizen on earth consumes more than the average American consumer consumes and all these government spending programs and entitlements do is just GUN THE CONSUMPTION EVEN MORE. How long will we last if we keep jacking up taxes on investment capital and funneling it toward a chicken-in-every-pot over-consuming society. Investment captital is NECESSARY to build businesses and create jobs... ... and Obama is dedicated to taxing that capital and giving it to Americans who would rather take it down to WalMart and buy chinese stuff with it. That's socialism. No nation adopts socialism and builds wealth and prosperity that way. If our society stops encouraging the formation and deployment of investment captial... the we are SUNK, my friend.

Topic.Title: High Un-employment, No Growth, Massive Deficits...

Message.Msg: If Obama punishes those with investment capital and those people/corporations flee overseas or into tax shelters as a result... ... then all of us suffer because we need that investment capital to build businesses and employ Americans. Think about it... how long can we keep jumping taxes on investment capital and giving it to other Americans who are pre-disposed to taking it down to WalMart and buying Chinese stuff with it... ... how long will we last if we keep doing that? That's EXACTLY the behavior Obama is encouraging in America.

Topic.Title: High Un-employment, No Growth, Massive Deficits...

Message.Msg: We're all rich! Well, compared to the over 50% of the world population, that spends all day, everyday, just looking for food and water. And here we are, spending time typing on our coal powered computers, arguing about only being 90% employed and having to, one day, pay our debts. Why don't we get together and suck it up, Congress too, and work weekends for a year, without vacations, and see if we can put a dent in our problems - together, without whining about everything. Huh? Why?
